p: Second, in those suffering from mild SARS-CoV-2 infection, it may be reasonable to continue treatment. Considerations for stopping treatment may be undertaken in those taking drugs with greater immunosuppressive effects, having risk factors for severe disease, or in those already suffering from severe infection. Treatment can be restarted after 4 weeks or after complete resolution of symptoms, keeping in mind the risk of rebound MS activity with sphingosine-1-phosphate modulators and natalizumab.
